alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern DeSoto, east central Tunica and northwestern Tate Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 314 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Phillipp, or 11 miles southwest of Hernando, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hernando, Eudora, Phillipp, Robinson Gin, Prichard, Trinity and Frees Corners. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Mississippi.
